chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: We will talk about Loops in Python  And I will quickly take you to the computer screen  So that we can learn things in very good code  I have made a file named 0900 in the name of Loops  So that you can see

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: And here we have two types of Mail Loops in Python  One is For Loop and one is While Loop  For Loop means we iterate over a sequence  If you don't know what the list is  Then you shouldn't look at Python Refreshers

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: You should learn a Python code  So I assume that you know what the list is in Python  So the collection of different data types is the same  The same data type can also be done  Here we have taken a list of off-routes

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: And we can iterate like this  So if I have some numbers, let us say L is equal to  Here I have written L is equal to 3, 5, 6  And one more, let me say 67  So I can print 4 items in L and print them

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: And all the items will be printed in 3, 5, 6 and 67  This is called I Trating the Loop  And I can print all the items by iterating the loop  Or I can do something else with it  So this is our For Loop

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: After this we have a For Loop with Range  Let us say I want to print all the numbers from 0 to 100  So I will write For I in Range  And I will do 10 here  And I will print I here

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: Now the question that will be asked in the interview  Is what will be its output  Its output starts from 0 to 9  Many people tell the answer from 0 to 10  And the answer of the question is wrong

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: So if I print Shift Enter, it goes from 0 to 9  If you want 10 to 0, you have to write 11 in the range  Like a rule of thumb, you can think that  Range n goes from 0 to n minus 1  And if you want to start from 1, you can do something like this

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: Like if I in Range 1 comma 10  So now it will go from 1 to 9  So if I want to run the loop from 1 to 10  Then I will do something like this  And my loop will go from 1 to 10

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: I can start this loop from 5  So I will do 5 comma 11 in the range  So it will go from 5 to 10  And so on  You can iterate till your favorite range

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: You are saying that  Take 5 to 10  Alright, so this was our For Loop with Range  So For Loop is a very simple thing  It is a very basic thing

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: You have to iterate a sequence  Or you have to produce a range of numbers  So this is For Loop  Now we will see the While Loop  What is the While Loop

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: The While Loop is a loop that runs as long as the condition is true  For example, here I have initially zeroed the count  Then I am saying that until the count is smaller than 3  While count is less than 3  You print it

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: And along with that, I am updating the count  I am increasing the count from 1  So initially the count value was zero  Count is less than 3  Yes, then it will go into the loop

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: It will print the count which is zero  And after that it will make the count one  Then it will run again  What is 1 less than 3  Yes, it will be one print

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: It will make the count 2  It will run again  What is 2 less than 3  Yes, it will print the count  Which is 2

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: It will stop the loop  And the loop execution will end  And this output will come  So this is how the While Loop works  So if I write a While Loop example

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: I will write  While I is less than 12  I will say print I  No, not I  And I will write

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: I is equal to I plus 1  And I will initialize it from zero  And try to guess the output  by yourself  So here I have written I is equal to zero

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: So it will run from zero  And the I value will increase  Finally I value will be 11  So 11 will be less than 12  And 11 will be printed

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: Then I value will be 12  So it will go from zero to 11  So you should do its dry run  And try to understand how it works  Because it is very essential

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: For you to understand  How it works  Awesome, so this is our While Loop  Now we understand about Loop Control Statements  Which is Break, Continue and Pass

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: Sometimes I have to write Loop  I wrote For, Item and L  And I want to see it later  I want to put it  I want to say that I will write this loop later

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: Let's do something else  So if I leave it like this  And I start writing my code  So what will happen  I will execute it, so this will be the error

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: But I want to write this loop later  So I can write Pass  And Pass means do nothing  Pass means do nothing  So I can do it like this

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: I can put it in function  I can put it in loops  So Pass means do nothing  Pass it  And here

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: Print Hello  Awesome  We have a Break statement  Like I have a loop  For one list L is equal to

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: We have apples  Bananas  And then tomatoes  And  I want

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: For, Item and L  And I want  Print Item  Print Item  If I enter Shift, all these will be printed

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: But I want  If the item is Bananas  Then stop there  And finish the execution of the loop  So I can write

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: If Item is equal to  Equals to Bananas  So what I want to do  I want to do a Break  So I have said

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: For Item and L  This condition will be false  Apples will be printed  Bananas will be printed  This condition will be true

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: And this will be a Break  This means finish the loop here  And don't execute it  So I will enter Shift  I have already done the Break

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: Now if I continue  The case of Continue  It happens like this  Skip this iteration  So what does Break mean?

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: I write it here  So that this notebook will work well  For revision  I write  Stop this loop right here

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: So finish this loop here  Pass means  Don't do anything  And Continue means  Stop

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: Stop  This particular  I iteration  Of the loop  So when I continue

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: I am saying that  Print Apple  Because this condition is false  Then when the item value will be Bananas  Then this condition will be true

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: And it will continue  Whenever there is a continuous statement  So what will happen?  We skip this iteration  And execute the next iteration

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: So the iteration of Tomatoes will be executed  And Apples and Tomatoes will be printed  So I skipped Bananas  I write it as Skip  Stop

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: Skip this particular iteration of the loop  Better wording  So it breaks  Stop this loop  I have written Loop right here

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: And Continue  So let's continue the break  And do the pass statements  I hope you understood  And I could explain

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: How Break works  How Continue works  How Pass works  How Loops works  I hope you understand

chunks.title: Loops in python
chunks.text: See you in the next video
